page.title: 05PICKARD'S STORE,BURRINGTON
page.content: Mr.Gordon Short is the 4th.generation of Pickard's Seed Merchants, founded in 1846.Seed is grown in Devon and West Somerset. 2,000 tons of seed are sold per year, mostly in Cornwall, Devon and Somerset, but some is sold in Yorkshire and Scotland. Pickard's is{the only supplier of seed for {thatching reed and corn dollies}in the country.Many kinds of grass seed are sold.Ten different mixtures are made for sheep and cattle.Seed oats, barley and wheat are sold.The seed is cleaned and dressed before sale.Pickard's also supply rolled barley and rolled oats for feeding corn.The corn is dried by hot air and stored in bins and bays. Each customer's corn is separately stored.The busy time starts in mid July, with winter barleys. Lorries can unload 120 tons an hour.
